java.lang.NullPointerException

This doesn't make any sense.  The NPE can only happen when the MenuItem has 
been disposed().  The first thing that MenuItem.setText() does is call 
checkWidget() (which succeeds) and then eventually calls widgetStyle().  
Between the call to checkWidget() and widgetStyle(), there are no callbacks so 
no application code could run that disposed the MenuItem.

SSQ, do you agree?

Jeff, could this be that class loader bug that turned NPE's into class not 
found errors?

I'm marking this a dup of "detached windows context menu" bug.  If you see it 
again, please reopen.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 68096 ***
